headerDisplay: For help and support please visit our GitHub Wiki. We hope you find this plugin useful!

username.title: Meross Username
username.description: Enter your Meross username to enable cloud devices.

password.title: Meross Password
password.description: Enter your Meross password to enable cloud devices.

userkey.title: Meross Key
userkey.description: Enter your Meross key to enable local devices. You don't need to enter this if you have entered your username and password above, even for local devices. For help with obtaining this value see the wiki.

connection.title: Connection Type
connection.description: Global setting for device connection type. This can also be set per accessory later in the config.

disableDeviceLogging.title: Disable Device Logging
disableDeviceLogging.description: Global logging setting for accessory status changes. If true then accessory status changes will not be logged. This can also be set per accessory later in the config.

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: Used to connect to Meross API, varies by region, example: `iotx-eu.meross.com` is a possible domain in Europe - inspect API calls to figure this if needed.

cloudRefreshRate.title: Cloud Refresh Rate
cloudRefreshRate.description: Number of seconds between polls to cloud devices. Maximum value 600. If set to 0, 600 will be used.

refreshRate.title: Local Refresh Rate
refreshRate.description: Number of seconds between polls to local devices. Maximum value 600. If set to 0, 600 will be used.

singleDevices.title: Single-Channel Devices
singleDevices.description: Optional settings for single-channel Meross switches/outlets.

name.title: Name
name.description: A label for this device, will be used as the HomeKit name if setting up a local device.

deviceUrl.title: Device IP
deviceUrl.description: Enter the IP address of this device for local connection.

ignoreDevice.title: Hide From HomeKit
ignoreDevice.description: If true, this accessory will be removed and ignored from HomeKit.

inUsePowerThreshold.title: 'In Use' Threshold
inUsePowerThreshold.description: HomeKit will set the 'In Use' status of outlet devices to true when the wattage is above this number. Only applies to models that support power readings. Must be 0 or more.

temperatureSource.title: Temperature Sensor ID
temperatureSource.description: Enter a Meross, eWeLink or Govee device ID which provides a current temperature reading.

firmwareRevision.title: Firmware Version
firmwareRevision.description: For local devices, HomeKit will show this as the firmware version.

userkey.title: Device (User) Key
userkey.description: Override the user key for this device if it is registered to a different Meross account.
